result.execSummary:
The defendant Aloyioious Paul Griffin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. Huber privileges for work with credit for 3 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
- Court set restitution at zero.
- Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.
- All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, to convert to a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aloyioious Paul Griffin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aloyioious Paul Griffin in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Aloyioious Paul Griffin.  Attorney Samuel Tabin in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Count 1:
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
*
Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 45 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work with credit for 3 days time served.
Court stayed the sentence and placed defendant on 6 months probation.
Conditions of probation are:
- maintain work and school
- no possession of firearms
- participate firearms safety course

Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, to convert to a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.

Defendant Aloyioious Paul Griffin in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pretrial conference. Defense requested aprojected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 13.  Case remains calendered for jury trial same day at 9 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Aloyioious Paul Griffin in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aloyioious Paul Griffin appeared by video means with Attorney. Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Aloyioious Paul Griffin in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aloyioious Paul Griffin appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Defense need discovery and offer.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
On court motion the 4/12/2022 pretrial conference is adjourned to 4/11/2022 at 2:30 pm.  SPD Jason Findling to inform defendant of the new date.     vk

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Aloyioious Paul Griffin in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Aloyioious Paul Griffin in custody.  Allysa Bria Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aloyioious Paul Griffin appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Motion to dismiss by defense for lack of probable cause argued and DENIED by the Court.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
